most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Login and Database Errors
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with login failures and database corruption after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.x.  Login issues involved infinite loading screens and 500 errors. Database errors prevented application launch. Solutions included bug fixes, database resets, and addressing AVX2 CPU compatibility.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Author:** @utrack
**Date:** 2025-04-17
**Issue:** Auth not working properly on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* @utrack reports auth issue on Linux and provides calendar link for real-time debugging.
* @utrack asks @nathan-courtney-pieces to confirm if auth is working properly on Linux.

**Problems Identified:**

* Auth functionality not working on @utrack's Linux system.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @pieces-support-bot suggests checking related issues and resources.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requests log files and Linux OS information for troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No further updates are available in the conversation excerpt provided. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue is being investigated by the Pieces support team.
* It is unclear whether a solution has been found or implemented.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points:**

- Users reported infinite loading on `https://authentication.pieces.services/` during login.
- This issue occurred after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0
- The issue affected logins with both Google and GitHub accounts.
- Screen recordings and support logs were provided for debugging.

**Problems:**

- The authentication flow was broken after the update.
- Users were unable to link their Google accounts.
- The issue potentially affected cloud backups and domain connections.

**Solutions:**

- The Pieces team investigated the issue and identified the root cause.
- A fix was implemented within a few hours.

**Current status:**

- Authentication is working again for users who reported the issue.

**Outcome:**

- The issue was resolved swiftly thanks to the collaboration of users and the Pieces team.

**Additional notes:**

- For other users experiencing similar issues, checking the support logs is recommended.
- Reopening the issue is possible if the problem persists.

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons

[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @antoine79 is experiencing an issue where the application won't launch.
* The initial database bootup seems to be causing the problem.
* Even after uninstalling and deleting the database folder, the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* Corrupted database error due to missing subfolder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2`.
* This folder is required for creating the `_backup.sql` file.
* User's CPU (Intel i7-2600) lacks AVX2 support, which is required for the `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension used by Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces Support is working on a fix to address the missing subfolder issue.
* A new version (11.3.2) will be released soon to address the AVX2 dependency issue by providing an alternative implementation for users with unsupported CPUs.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix for the missing subfolder issue is being implemented.
* Version 11.3.2 has been released, addressing the AVX2 dependency issue.
* The issue is considered resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* User @antoine79 provided valuable information about their specific hardware and the error logs, which helped identify the root cause of the problem.
* Mark from Pieces Support was responsive and helpful throughout the troubleshooting process.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS login and account linking issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various login and account linking problems, including infinite loading, 500 errors, and single account linking limitations. These issues were often tied to specific Pieces OS versions or platforms. Solutions involved bug fixes, manual account merging by support, and the development of a new authentication system.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of the GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**
* User (@johnkennyuk) is experiencing issues linking their Google and Github accounts.
* This was due to the email addresses being registered with different capitalizations.

**Problems Identified:**
* Account linking process is not user-friendly.
* Email capitalization discrepancy caused merging issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Manual account merging assistance offered by support team (@mark-at-pieces).
* Resetting user accounts to attempt linking again.
* New authentication system with unified account linking is under development.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* User's issue temporarily resolved through manual merging.
* Waiting for the new authentication system to be fully implemented for permanent solution.
* New system expected to be released in early/mid March.

**Additional Notes:**
* User will be informed when the new system is ready for use.
* Manual account resetting will be provided before attempting relinking.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup and Authentication Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with Pieces OS failing to start or encountering authentication errors. Problems included invalid port errors, database corruption, and HTTP 500 errors during login. Solutions involved ensuring admin privileges during installation, addressing database dependencies, and ongoing investigation by the Pieces support team.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Invalid Port error when Launching Pieces

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@SherlockSol) reported an "Invalid Port" error when launching Pieces Desktop.
* User shared log files and Windows Build Number.
* Another user (@uzaxirr) reported experiencing the same issue.

**Problems:**

* Cause of the "Invalid Port" error was unclear.
* Reproduction of the issue was difficult.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User (@zedevmed) suggested installing PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop with WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.
* Pieces team member (@tsavo-at-pieces) acknowledged the solution and confirmed adjustments are being made.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved by installing Pieces with admin privileges using WinGet.
* Documentation will be updated to promote the MSIX or WinGet installation methods.

**Additional Notes:**

* Video call troubleshooting was offered to the original user, but there is no update on whether it occurred.
* It is unclear if the issue is specific to Windows 10 Enterprise or if it affects other versions of Windows as well.

* Even after uninstalling and deleting the database folder, the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* Corrupted database error due to missing subfolder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2`.
* This folder is required for creating the `_backup.sql` file.
* User's CPU (Intel i7-2600) lacks AVX2 support, which is required for the `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension used by Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces Support is working on a fix to address the missing subfolder issue.
* A new version (11.3.2) will be released soon to address the AVX2 dependency issue by providing an alternative implementation for users with unsupported CPUs.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix for the missing subfolder issue is being implemented.
* Version 11.3.2 has been released, addressing the AVX2 dependency issue.
* The issue is considered resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* User @antoine79 provided valuable information about their specific hardware and the error logs, which helped identify the root cause of the problem.
* Mark from Pieces Support was responsive and helpful throughout the troubleshooting process.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301

[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Author:** @utrack
**Date:** 2025-04-17
**Issue:** Auth not working properly on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* @utrack reports auth issue on Linux and provides calendar link for real-time debugging.
* @utrack asks @nathan-courtney-pieces to confirm if auth is working properly on Linux.

**Problems Identified:**

* Auth functionality not working on @utrack's Linux system.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @pieces-support-bot suggests checking related issues and resources.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requests log files and Linux OS information for troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No further updates are available in the conversation excerpt provided. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue is being investigated by the Pieces support team.
* It is unclear whether a solution has been found or implemented.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash on Startup: Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashing on startup due to database corruption on macOS and Windows. Error messages indicate failure to initialize the database. Issue linked to new plugin integration, missing subfolders in database directory, and AVX2 CPU incompatibility. Solutions include updating to the latest version (11.3.2), which addresses AVX2 dependency and includes fixes for database initialization.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* moazzem-pixel reported an application crash on macOS 12.3 with MacBook Air (M2).
* The user experienced crashes after updating from version 10.9.5.
* Expected behavior: Application to launch without crashing and function as intended.

**Problems identified:**

* The issue was potentially similar to a previously reported one: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested checking the similar issue and updating to the latest version 11.3.2.
* Mark-at-pieces recommended scheduling a support call if the issue persisted after updating.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was likely resolved with the latest version 11.3.2.
* The user was instructed to reopen the ticket if the problem persisted after updating.
* Current status is unclear as the user hasn't provided feedback.

**Additional notes:**

* Further investigation might be needed if the issue persists.
* Relevant logs and error messages were provided by the user for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key points raised:**

* @moazzem-pixel reported that Pieces OS is not launching due to a database corruption issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS is unable to start due to a corrupted database.
* This is a duplicate issue of a previously reported problem (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggests continuing the conversation on the original issue thread (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).

**Current status/outcome:**

* The conversation has been moved to the original issue thread.
* It is unclear if a solution has been implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue creator was provided with links to related resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.

**Overall, this issue highlights the importance of searching for existing solutions before creating new issues.**

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @antoine79 is experiencing an issue where the application won't launch.
* The initial database bootup seems to be causing the problem.
* Even after uninstalling and deleting the database folder, the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* Corrupted database error due to missing subfolder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2`.
* This folder is required for creating the `_backup.sql` file.
* User's CPU (Intel i7-2600) lacks AVX2 support, which is required for the `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension used by Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces Support is working on a fix to address the missing subfolder issue.
* A new version (11.3.2) will be released soon to address the AVX2 dependency issue by providing an alternative implementation for users with unsupported CPUs.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix for the missing subfolder issue is being implemented.
* Version 11.3.2 has been released, addressing the AVX2 dependency issue.
* The issue is considered resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* User @antoine79 provided valuable information about their specific hardware and the error logs, which helped identify the root cause of the problem.
* Mark from Pieces Support was responsive and helpful throughout the troubleshooting process.

recommendations: **Prioritize database and authentication issues:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around Pieces OS login, account linking, and database errors. Allocating more resources to investigate and resolve these root causes will significantly impact overall support volume.

**Investigate platform-specific problems:** Several issues are reported specifically on Windows and Linux. Focused testing and debugging on these platforms can help identify and address platform-specific bugs.

**Improve documentation for account linking and installation:** Issues related to account linking and installation (like the invalid port error) suggest a need for clearer documentation. Providing step-by-step guides and troubleshooting tips can empower users to resolve these issues independently.

**Proactively address CPU compatibility:** The AVX2 CPU incompatibility issue caused significant problems. Implementing a system to detect incompatible hardware and offer alternative solutions or guidance can prevent similar issues in the future.

**Monitor and analyze support trends:** Regularly analyze support data to identify recurring issues, emerging trends, and areas for improvement. This will enable proactive problem-solving and resource allocation for optimal support operations.
